issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Add unit tests for HDFS command 'dfsadmin -set/clrSpaceQuota'

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Pathname /D:/hadoop-trunk/hadoop/hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/target/test/data/qTr6mgA9Yv/TestQuota/testQuotaCommands from D:/hadoop-trunk/hadoop/hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/target/test/data/qTr6mgA9Yv/TestQuota/testQuotaCommands is not a valid DFS filename.

	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DistributedFileSystem.getPathName(DistributedFileSystem.java:212)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DistributedFileSystem$25.doCall(DistributedFileSystem.java:1119)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DistributedFileSystem$25.doCall(DistributedFileSystem.java:1116)
	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystemLinkResolver.resolve(FileSystemLinkResolver.java:81)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DistributedFileSystem.mkdirsInternal(DistributedFileSystem.java:1133)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.DistributedFileSystem.mkdirs(DistributedFileSystem.java:1108)
	at org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem.mkdirs(FileSystem.java:2218)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Remove PathUtils#getTestPath() as it's not usable for hdfs path in windows

This message was automatically generated.

I lik [~linyiqun]'s idea.

p.s. {{public static Path getTestPath(Class<?> caller, boolean create)}} should be calling {{getTestDirName(caller, create);}}? Don't know why the existing code is not.

[~linyiqun] and [~liuml07] ,thanks for looking into this issue..

bq. I am thinking we can add the additional operation to get a valid path in case the operation system is Windows.

Yes, it's make sense.

bq. p.s. public static Path getTestPath(Class<?> caller, boolean create) should be calling getTestDirName(caller, create);?

I also feel, it should be called this, orelse {{create}} param will not used..

Uploading the patch to address all this.

This message was automatically generated.

Directly changing the {{PathUtils}} may add confusion where this method is called to get the local filesystem path. Ex: {{TestDiskBalancerCommand}}.

TestQuota (and possibly other) usages of PathUtils are to get the randomized HDFS path, not Local Path. Since each running test have its own HDFS cluster to run with, randomness in path not required. It can run with simple path names such as '/testquota/test1'. So I feel for the current issue fix, patch v1 looks better.

The comment from [~vinayrpet] makes sense for me. [~brahmareddy], would you make a fix in class {{TestQuotaByStorageType}} as well? I think some test running there are also no need using {{PathUtils#getTestPath}} to get local path.

[~vinayrpet] and [~linyiqun] thanks for your thoughts.

I feel, as of now we can remove {{ PathUtils.getTestPath(getClass()}} as it's used in getting {{hdfs}} paths which will not work in windows.

Kindly review.

This message was automatically generated.

We could also start using GenericTestUtils to create these paths.
We fixed something similar in HDFS-13268 which relies on HDFS-13296.
I'd like to get this for branch-2.9 too; can we provide a patch for that one too?

The patch is good for most of the failed test cases on Windows. But still
